title: The Duchess of Sussex practises one of the Duchess of Cambridge’s most valuable style lessons
text:
The Duchess of Sussex became ‘the Duchess of downplaying it’ on her recent tour of South Africa with husband Prince Harry. After a summer filled with private jet ‘gates’, engagement ring remodelling, and a whirl through some of the world’s most expensive designer clothes (by couture labels from Givenchy to Dior) the seemingly obvious retooling of their image began in Meghan’s wardrobe.

Meghan’s case for her trip to South Africa, for the most part, was packed full of re-wears; from the blue belted shirt-dress by Veronica Beard, bought for her first royal tour in Tonga, to the black Mother Denim jeans that she wore to the Invictus Games in 2017. It seemed an entirely deliberate (and very good)...
description: The Duchess of Sussex became ‘the Duchess of downplaying it’ on her recent tour of South Africa with husband Prince Harry.
